flow.descriptionCdata:
70c74203-06bf-4a2a-9516-96584616e860.025aaf3f-6da0-478c-a746-e5b2978dafb2.description=Checks to see if a job is completed or not Inputs\: coreHost - The DNS name or IP Address of your SAS core. corePort - The port to Connect to your SAS core on. coreProtocol - The protocol to connect to your SAS core with. Either HTTP or HTTPS. coreUsername - The username for host. corePassword - The password for host. coreVersion - The version of SAS to use. jobID - the id of the job Responses\: running - job is still running completed - job has completed or is terminated in error failure - failed to retrieve data 70c74203-06bf-4a2a-9516-96584616e860.17cd5e84-74eb-4325-a052-de16062af76c.description=
Checks if a number or word is equal to another number or word. Word comparison is case-sensitive in alphabetical order.

Inputs\:
value1 - The first value.
value2 - The second value.

Returns\:
value1 \=\= value2

Responses\:
success - The boolean operation was evaluated to true.
failure - Something went wrong or the boolean operation returned false.
70c74203-06bf-4a2a-9516-96584616e860.2ec360e6-f6b2-4d54-b479-dc66e04ee304.description=Start a compliance scan for the given server. Inputs\: coreHost - The DNS name or IP Address of your SAS core. corePort - The port to Connect to your SAS core on. coreProtocol - The protocol to connect to your SAS core with. Either HTTP or HTTPS. coreUsername - The username for host. corePassword - The password for host. coreVersion - The version of SAS to use. serverName - The name of the server. serverID - The object id for the server. Responses\: success - retrieved successfully failure - failed to retrieve data Returns\: id - The unique ID of this object. description - The description of this object. blockedReason - The reason why this job is blocked. cancelledReason - The reason why this job is canceled. endDate - The date at which this job will cease to run. notificationFailureOwner - The user who will own this job if it fails. notificationSuccessOwner - The user who will own this job if it completes. notificationFailureRecipients - A ; delimited list of users who will receive notification if this job fails. notificationSuccessRecipients - A ; delimited list of users who will receive notification if this job completes. serverName - The name of the server associated with this job. serverId - The id of the server associated with this job. staleDate - The date after which this job is considered stale. startDate - The date where this job started. status - This object's status. username - This object's user name. userTag - This object's unique user tag. 70c74203-06bf-4a2a-9516-96584616e860.53cc0765-8f02-4f3b-9970-5951d15cf718.description=Checks to see if a job is completed or not Inputs\: coreHost - The DNS name or IP Address of your SAS core. corePort - The port to Connect to your SAS core on. coreProtocol - The protocol to connect to your SAS core with. Either HTTP or HTTPS. coreUsername - The username for host. corePassword - The password for host. coreVersion - The version of SAS to use. jobID - the id of the job Responses\: running - job is still running completed - job has completed or is terminated in error failure - failed to retrieve data 70c74203-06bf-4a2a-9516-96584616e860.584aac5b-ff8a-4107-8da4-8348b3dbc2c7.description=Assigns a patch policy to each server, device group or hypervisor contained in the list of attachable items. Inputs\: coreHost - The DNS name or IP Address of your SAS core. corePort - The port to Connect to your SAS core on. coreProtocol - The protocol to connect to your SAS core with. Either HTTP or HTTPS. coreUsername - The username for host. corePassword - The password for host. coreVersion - The version of SAS to use. patchPolicyName - The name of the patch policy. patchPolicyID - The ID of the patch policy. If this input is provided, then patchPolicyName is ignored. patchPolicyType - The type of the patch policy. Possible values are\: ANY, WINDOWS, UNIX(for Solaris, Ubuntu and Red Hat patch policies). Default value is ANY. attachableNames - A 'separator' separated list of server, device group or hypervisor names to which the patch policy will be attached. The elements of the list must be all of the same type. (e.g. names of servers) attachableIDs - A 'separator' separated list of server, device group or hypervisor IDs to which the patch policy will be attached. The elements of the list must be all of the same type. (e.g. ids of servers) attachableType - The type of the attachable items. Can be one of the following values\: SERVER, DEVICE_GROUP, HYPERVISOR. separator - The separator used for separating the inputs. The default value for the separator is comma (,). Responses\: success - retrieved successfully failure - failed to retrieve data 70c74203-06bf-4a2a-9516-96584616e860.61638414-ffb5-4537-bb36-d9ec30a274a1.description=Retrieves patch policy compliance scan summary for a server. This operation is not supported by SAS 6.x. The returned result will contain the compliance status of the given server. Inputs\: coreHost - The DNS name or IP Address of your SAS core. corePort - The port to Connect to your SAS core on. coreProtocol - The protocol to connect to your SAS core with. Either HTTP or HTTPS. coreUsername - The username for host. corePassword - The password for host. coreVersion - The version of SAS to use. patchPolicyNames - A comma separated list of patch policy names. If left blank, the operation will get the patch policy compliance scan summaries for all the patch policies that are attached to the server. patchPolicyIDs - A comma separated list of patch policy ids. serverName - The name of the server. serverID - The id of the server. Responses\: success - retrieved successfully failure - failed to retrieve data Returns\: complianceScanResultCode - Result code for the compliance scan complianceScanName - Name of the compliance scan complianceScanID - ID of the compliance scan complianceScanResultName - Name of the compliance scan result complianceScanResultID - ID of the compliance scan result complianceScanTargetName - Name of the compliance scan target complianceScanTargetID - ID of the compliance scan target complianceScanFailedRuleCount - Number of failed rules in the compliance scan complianceScanPartiallyPassedRuleCount - Number of partially passed rules in the compliance scan complianceScanTotalRuleCount - Total number of rules in the compliance scan complianceScanSystemFailure - Failure while running the scan (if any) complianceScanTestDate - The date the compliance scan was run on isServerCompliant - Returns 'true' is the server is compliant with the patch policies specified by the 'patchPolicyNames' input. If no patch policies were specified, returns 'true' if the server is compliant with all attached patch policies. Returns 'false' otherwise. 70c74203-06bf-4a2a-9516-96584616e860.61db395e-16d7-4300-98ea-c58911cf357f.description=This operation could be used to remediate the given server against a given set of directly attached patch policies. If the patch policies information is not provided, then a full patch policy remediation is performed. Inputs\: coreHost - The DNS name or IP Address of your SAS core. corePort - The port to Connect to your SAS core on. coreProtocol - The protocol to connect to your SAS core with. Either HTTP or HTTPS. coreUsername - The username for host. corePassword - The password for host. coreVersion - The version of SAS to use. serverName - List of names for servers to remediate(separated by 'separator'). If multiple servers are specified then they must be of the same platform type. serverID - List of ids for servers to remediate(separated by 'separator'). If this input is provided then 'serverName' is ignored. If multiple servers are specified then they must be of the same platform type. wait - An integer value specifying how many milliseconds should be waited for the job to finish. If not specified the job is started, but may not have finished. patchPoliciesNames - Name of the patch policies (separated by 'separator'). patchPoliciesIDs - Object ids of the patch policies (separated by 'separator'). rebootOption - Reboot Option for Remediating a server. It could be one of [suppress, per_action, at_end] or it can be left blank. Where\: - suppress - Suppress all reboots; - per_action - Reboot after each installation or uninstallation; - at_end - Reboot at the end of remediation; - left blank (no value provided) - Reboot as specified by individual software items. continueOnFailure - Set whether to continue or not if a failure happens during the remediation job. The default value is 'true'. windowsPatchInstallationOrder - Set to true to remediate only Windows offline catalog patches, if available. The default value is 'false'. sortPolicies - Specify whether the software policies should be remediated in alphabetical order, based on their names, on each server. The default value is 'false'. ticketID - The ticket ID for this job. If not specified it will be set default value\: 'Remediation started by SA user from OO server 'host_address' separator - The separator used for separating the inputs. The default value for the separator is a comma (,). expandAtRuntime - Specify whether the patch policies attached to the servers should be expanded at runtime. The default value is 'false'. notificationFailureOwner - The email address of the owner of the job when the job failed. notificationSuccessOwner - The email address of the owner of the job when the job succeeded. notificationCancelOwner - The email address of the owner of the job when the job was canceled. notificationFailureRecipients - The email addresses to notify when the job failed. notificationSuccessRecipients - The email addresses to notify when the job succeeded. notificationCancelRecipients - The email addresses to notify when the job was canceled. scheduleDateYear - The year to be used for setting the date when the job is scheduled to start. This input must be provided for setting a job schedule. scheduleDateMonth - The month to be used for setting the date when the job is scheduled to start. It should have the value between 1 and 12. This input must be provided for setting a job schedule. scheduleDateDayOfMonth - The day to be used for setting the date when the job is scheduled to start. It should have the value between 1 and 31. This input must be provided for setting a job schedule. scheduleDateHour - The hour to be used for setting the date when the job is scheduled to start. It should have the value between 0 and 23. If not set, if will have the default value 0. scheduleDateMinute - The minute to be used for setting the date when the job is scheduled to start. It should have the value between 0 and 59. If not set, if will have the default value 0. scheduleDateSecond - The second to be used for setting the date when the job is scheduled to start. It should have the value between 0 and 59. If not set, if will have the default value 0. scheduleDateTimezone - The timezone used to express the job schedule date. If not set, it will have the default value GMT. Responses\: success - The operation completed successfully. failure - Something went wrong. Returns\: returnResult - The id of the job created. 70c74203-06bf-4a2a-9516-96584616e860.76527162-950d-4e68-96ce-c1c815aa6a24.description=Reboot the given Server managed in SA. Inputs\: coreHost - The DNS name or IP Address of your SAS core. corePort - The port to Connect to your SAS core on. coreProtocol - The protocol to connect to your SAS core with. Either HTTP or HTTPS. coreUsername - The username for host. corePassword - The password for host. coreVersion - The version of SAS to use. agent - Name of the server to reboot now. serverID - The ID of the server to reboot. If specified, the 'agent' input will be ignored. wait - An integer value specifying How many milliseconds should be waited for the job to finish. If not specified the job is started, but may not have finished. Responses\: success - The operation completed successfully. failure - Something went wrong. Returns\: returnResult - The id of the job created. 70c74203-06bf-4a2a-9516-96584616e860.9960359e-0bb9-4099-bf2d-0c65bd45a805.description=Waits for the job to reach a specific state. If no state is specified, then this will wait for the job to reach an end state. Inputs\: coreHost - The DNS name or IP Address of your SAS core. corePort - The port to Connect to your SAS core on. coreProtocol - The protocol to connect to your SAS core with. Either HTTP or HTTPS. coreUsername - The username for host. corePassword - The password for host. coreVersion - The version of SAS to use. jobID - The id of the job. status - The status to wait for the job to reach. If none is specified this will wait until the job is no longer running. timeout - The maximum number of milliseconds to wait for the job. If not specified, 1 hour is used. frequency - The frequency, in milliseconds, with which the operation will check if the job has reached the specified state (or an end state). The default value is 5000 ms. Responses\: failure - Something went wrong. success - The operation completed successfully. 70c74203-06bf-4a2a-9516-96584616e860.b7216773-38e6-4858-88d1-c4bc382960c2.description=
This operation waits for the number of seconds specified in the "seconds" input.

Inputs\:
    seconds - The number of seconds to wait.

Results\:
    resultString – This is the primary output. It contains the "completed sleep" message if the operation completed successfully and an error message otherwise. 

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully.
70c74203-06bf-4a2a-9516-96584616e860.f3a18c9a-5e42-446a-96fa-ddea9df6180e.description=
This operation waits for the number of seconds specified in the "seconds" input.

Inputs\:
    seconds - The number of seconds to wait.

Results\:
    resultString – This is the primary output. It contains the "completed sleep" message if the operation completed successfully and an error message otherwise. 

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully.
flow.name: Attach and Remediate Patch Policy in ECC

staticBinding.value: Vendor Recommended Patch Policy for Windows 2012 x64

step.name: Get Patch Policy Compliance Scan Summary
